required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Controlled Ovarian Stimulation in Quality of Oocyte and Embryo
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Controlled Ovarian Stimulation With H FSH and HHMg Vs HMG Alone on Oocyte and Embryo Quality in IcsI Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Investigate and compare the efficacy of H FSH plus HMG Vs HMG alone on oocyte and embryo quality in IcsI patients

detailed_description.textblock: 70 patients divided in to 2groups Group A controlled ovarian stimulation with H FSH and HHMg Group B controlled ovarian stimulation with HMG alone Results will be discussed later

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison between the efficacy of controlled ovarian stimulation with H FSH plus HMG Vs HmG alone on oocyte and embryo quality in IcsI patients
primary_outcome.description: Comparison between the efficacy of controlled ovarian stimulation with H FSH plus HMG Vs HmG alone on oocyte and embryo quality in IcsI patients

arm_group.description: Induction of ovulation from 2nd day of cycle Follow diameter of follicle When follicle 18:22mm Receive HMG
Follow up ovulation from the 2nd day to 5th of menstruation cycle When follicle diameter 18mm to 22mm made induction of ovulation

intervention.description: Induction of ovulation from the 2nd day of cycle to 5th day then follow the diameter of follicle Use transvaginal ultrasound When diameter of follicle 18 to 22 patients receiving HMG

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Infertil women aged from 20_35yr
2. Normal utreus
3. Normal ovaries
4. unexplained infertility
5. no endometriosis
Exclusion Criteria:
1 - poor responders to gonadotropin 2-Prior history of more than 3unsucceful ICSI 3-Any malformation of sexual organs
